title: Dinosaur Facts Quiz
description: Match dinosaurs to their characteristics and era

questions.question: Which massive dinosaur was one of the largest land animals ever, had a very long neck and tail, and was an herbivore from the Late Jurassic period?
Which fearsome predator from the Late Cretaceous period had tiny arms, enormous jaws, and is often called the 'king of the dinosaurs'?
Which herbivore had three horns on its face, a large bony frill, and lived during the Late Cretaceous period?
Which dinosaur had large bony plates along its back and spikes on its tail, and lived during the Late Jurassic period?
Which small, feathered dinosaur from the Late Cretaceous was a swift predator with a sickle-shaped claw on each foot?
Which flying reptile (not technically a dinosaur) had a wingspan of up to 36 feet, making it one of the largest flying animals ever?
Which duck-billed dinosaur had a distinctive long, curved crest on its head that may have been used to produce sounds?
Which heavily armored dinosaur had a large club at the end of its tail and lived during the Late Cretaceous period?
Which dinosaur is often considered the earliest known bird, had feathered wings, and lived during the Late Jurassic period?
Which large predatory dinosaur from North Africa had a sail-like structure on its back and may have been semi-aquatic?
During which geological era did dinosaurs first appear on Earth?
options: Cretaceous Period of the Mesozoic Era
Jurassic Period of the Mesozoic Era
Triassic Period of the Mesozoic Era

questions.question: Which dinosaur's name means 'terrible lizard' and was the term coined in 1842 by Sir Richard Owen to describe these ancient reptiles?
Which dome-headed dinosaur is believed to have used its thick skull for head-butting contests?
Approximately how many years ago did the mass extinction event occur that wiped out the non-avian dinosaurs?
Which dinosaur, whose name means 'good mother lizard,' was one of the first found with evidence of nesting behavior and parental care?
